segment.source: Recovery media (bare metal recovery) helps restore a Windows device to the factory state, even if the user needs to replace the hard drive or completely wipe the drive clean.
segment.target: Recovery media (bare metal recovery) helps restore a Windows device to the factory state, even if the user needs to replace the hard drive or completely wipe the drive clean.

segment.source: Windows uses the built-in Windows files, including recent Windows and driver updates, plus any customizations included in the OEM provisioning package, to create the recovery media.
segment.target: Windows uses the built-in Windows files, including recent Windows and driver updates, plus any customizations included in the OEM provisioning package, to create the recovery media.

segment.source: If you deploy Windows using the default partition layout, your users will be able to create bare metal recovery media by default.
segment.target: If you deploy Windows using the default partition layout, your users will be able to create bare metal recovery media by default.

segment.source: If you're deploying Windows with a custom partition layout, you'll need to add a few configuration files to enable your users to create bare metal recovery media:
segment.target: If you're deploying Windows with a custom partition layout, you'll need to add a few configuration files to enable your users to create bare metal recovery media:

segment.source: A partition reset script, which is a modified DiskPart script that resets your custom partition layout.
segment.target: A partition reset script, which is a modified DiskPart script that resets your custom partition layout.

segment.source: A push-button reset configuration file (ResetConfig XML) that identifies the Windows and Windows RE partitions.
segment.target: A push-button reset configuration file (ResetConfig XML) that identifies the Windows and Windows RE partitions.

segment.source: Identifying the system drive
segment.target: Identifying the system drive

segment.source: Windows identifies the system drive using the following methods:
segment.target: Windows identifies the system drive using the following methods:

segment.source: BIOS-based computers: the BIOS-reported system drive is used.
segment.target: BIOS-based computers: the BIOS-reported system drive is used.

segment.source: UEFI-based computers: When Windows RE is enabled by using the command, Windows writes the adaptor location path and GUID of the system disk to a UEFI variable.
segment.target: UEFI-based computers: When Windows RE is enabled by using the command, Windows writes the adaptor location path and GUID of the system disk to a UEFI variable.

segment.source: This step is only performed when both the system and OS partitions are on the system drive.
segment.target: This step is only performed when both the system and OS partitions are on the system drive.

segment.source: The variable is updated if necessary when Windows RE gets disabled and then re-enabled.
segment.target: The variable is updated if necessary when Windows RE gets disabled and then re-enabled.

segment.source: If multiple local drives are detected, Windows identifies the system drive by searching in the following order:
segment.target: If multiple local drives are detected, Windows identifies the system drive by searching in the following order:

segment.source: Windows searches for a drive with a GUID matching the value stored in firmware.
segment.target: Windows searches for a drive with a GUID matching the value stored in firmware.

segment.source: Windows searches for a drive with a location path matching the value stored in firmware.
segment.target: Windows searches for a drive with a location path matching the value stored in firmware.

segment.source: Windows searches for a drive with an existing ESP.
segment.target: Windows searches for a drive with an existing ESP.

segment.source: If multiple drives with ESP are found, the recovery process will not proceed.
segment.target: If multiple drives with ESP are found, the recovery process will not proceed.

segment.source: Windows searches for an uninitialized (raw) disk.
segment.target: Windows searches for an uninitialized (raw) disk.

segment.source: If multiple uninitialized disks are found, the recovery process will not proceed.
segment.target: If multiple uninitialized disks are found, the recovery process will not proceed.
